thread.title: High-school football | City League roundup: Markos, Watterson run over Beechcroft
thread.title_full: High-school football | City League roundup: Markos, Watterson run over Beechcroft

title: High-school football | City League roundup: Markos, Watterson run over Beechcroft
text:
Saturday October 10, 2015 6:28 AM 
Watterson 30, Beechcroft 21 
Quarterback Stephen Markos had three short touchdown runs, and six Watterson rushers totaled 260 yards in a win over visiting Beechcroft Friday night in a nonleague game. 
Markos, who had 61 yards rushing on 15 carries, gave the Eagles (4-3) a 21-14 lead in the third quarter on a 1-yard plunge. 
After a Watterson safety, Macyah Fleming cut Beechcroft’s deficit to two with a 78-yard TD pass to Rodell Rahmaan, but Michael Audinno’s 5-yard run with 7:57 remaining gave the Eagles some breathing room. 
>> High-school football results, box scores from Week 7 
Audinno finished with 60 yards rushing, Max Bratka had 50, and Markos, who had TD runs of 1 and 4 yards in the first and second quarters, added 54 yards passing. 
Fleming completed 15 of 26 passes for 252 yards and two touchdown passes, both to Rahmaan, who had 144 yards receiving for Beechcroft (4-2). 
Whetstone 24, Northland 14 
Aiden Tuttle and Marcus Benson scored on short TD runs, and Whetstone (3-4, 2-1) upset league leader Northland (5-2, 3-1) in the City North. Michael Huston also returned a fumble for a TD for Whetstone. Mekko Wharton rushed for 163 yards on 29 carries and scored on TD runs of 24 and four yards for Northland. Dante Lewis completed 14 of 24 passes for 124 yards for the Vikings. 
Walnut Ridge 34, Briggs 10 
Malik Harrison had 111 yards rushing, 100 yards passing and scored two TDs, and Walnut Ridge (4-3, 3-1) pulled away in the second half from visiting Briggs (3-4, 1-3) in the City South. Harrison scored on runs of 21 and 6 yards. Tarik Wright scored two second-half TDs, including an 83-yard pass from Justin Vance. Walnut Ridge gained 439 yards, with 256 coming on the ground. It outgained Briggs by 216 yards. Tyson Miles scored on a 10-yard TD for Briggs. He rushed for 47 yards and threw for 95 yards. 
Marion-Franklin 27, Eastmoor Academy 20 
Justin King rushed for 173 yards on 27 carries and two TDs, and Marion-Franklin (4-3, 3-1) outlasted a fourth-quarter rally by visiting Eastmoor Academy (4-3, 3-1) in the City South. Derrione Leeper added for 122 yards rushing and two TDs for the Red Devils, who led 20-0 early in the fourth quarter. Eastmoor pulled to 20-14 on an 87-yard kickoff return by Savon Edwards and a 10-yard run by Daylin Jackson. King’s second TD put Marion-Franklin up 13 with 1:42 left. Eastmoor countered with 11-yard TD reception by Keeshawn Ramsey with 55 seconds left, but couldn’t corral the ensuing onside kick. 
Independence 46, West 36 
Ronnie Kuipers rushed for 283 yards and two TDs, and Independence (6-1, 4-0) rallied from an 14-8 halftime deficit to score 38 points in the second half and defeat visiting West (3-4, 1-3) in the City South. De’Zhan Townsend had a rushing TD and a passing TD in the third quarter to put Independence ahead 24-14. Kuipers then scored on TD runs of 36 and 79 yards for the Sixers, who totaled 482 yards rushing. West got two late TDs, including a 4-yard run from Byron White. He finished with 135 yards rushing. 
East 44, Centennial 26 
Quarterback Juwan Smith amassed 337 total yards and East (1-6, 1-3) downed host Centennial (2-5, 0-3) in the City North. Smith had 213 yards passing on nine completions and led East with 124 yards rushing and a 27-yard TD run.
